title: John Williams (rugby league)
text:
John Williams (born 5 January 1985, in <a href="Sydney">Sydney</a>, <a href="New%20South%20Wales">New South Wales</a>) is an Australian former professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 2000s. He played as a in the <a href="National%20Rugby%20League">National Rugby League</a> for the <a href="Parramatta%20Eels">Parramatta Eels</a>, <a href="Sydney%20Roosters">Sydney Roosters</a>, <a href="North%20Queensland%20Cowboys">North Queensland Cowboys</a> and <a href="Cronulla-Sutherland%20Sharks">Cronulla-Sutherland Sharks</a>.
Background.
Williams is the older brother of Australian international rugby league player, <a href="David%20Williams%20%28rugby%20league%29">David Williams</a>. He was given the choice to play first grade <a href="cricket">cricket</a> but instead he chose to play rugby league. 
Playing career.
Williams made his first grade debut for Parramatta in round 17 of the <a href="2005%20NRL%20season">2005 NRL season</a> against <a href="South%20Sydney%20Rabbitohs">South Sydney</a> at <a href="Parramatta%20Stadium">Parramatta Stadium</a> scoring a try in a 52-16 victory. Williams made one further appearance that year as the club won the <a href="Minor%20Premiership">Minor Premiership</a>.
In the <a href="2006%20NRL%20season">2006 NRL season</a>, Williams made four appearances for Parramatta and scored four tries including a <a href="hat-trick">hat-trick</a> against <a href="Melbourne%20Storm">Melbourne</a> in round 14 at <a href="Parramatta%20Stadium">Parramatta Stadium</a>. At the end of 2006, Williams was released by Parramatta and he signed a one-year deal to join the <a href="Sydney%20Roosters">Sydney Roosters</a>. At the end of 2007, Williams was not offered a contract extension and he signed with <a href="North%20Queensland%20Cowboys">North Queensland</a> for the <a href="2008%20NRL%20season">2008 NRL season</a>.
While he was a fringe player for a large part of his career, 2008 was certainly a highlight for Williams. Williams was a regular starter and leading point scorer for the Cowboys in that year with 96 points. Over his three years at North Queensland Williams played a total of 54 games, making it easily the most successful stage of his career.
In October 2010, Williams signed with the <a href="Cronulla-Sutherland%20Sharks">Cronulla-Sutherland Sharks</a> for the <a href="2011%20NRL%20season">2011 NRL season</a>. In 2012, he announced his retirement at the age of 27. Following his retirement, he was one of seventeen Cronulla players found guilty of using illegal substances under the club's <a href="Cronulla-Sutherland%20Sharks%20supplements%20saga">2011 supplements program</a>, having a twelve-month suspension (which had already expired due to backdating) recorded against his name.
Williams was considered to be a rugby league journeymen, joining four clubs over his eight-year career.
